intro: Cytheraea, commonly known as the glasswinged butterfly. It is a species of butterfly belonging to the family Nymphalidae, characterized by its strikingly transparent wings. The plant associated with Cytheraea is not a true plant but rather a type of flowering plant known as Cytheraea, which is sometimes referred to as the "sea holly." This plant is native to coastal areas and thrives in saline environments. It has blue or purple flowers and is often found growing in sandy soils along the shorelines.
